title: Wirksworth Walks

images.title: Anton Shone / The Dale, Wirksworth
images.caption: The Dale, Wirksworth. Looking north westwards over the Dale from Bowling Green Lane.

images.title: Dave Butlin / Almshouses, Wirksworth
images.caption: The old Almshouses in Wirksworth Churchyard.

images.title: Mike Fowkes / Wirksworth.
images.caption: The Parish Church of St Mary the Virgin with hills in the background.

images.title: Jonathan Clitheroe / Chapel Lane, Wirksworth
images.caption: Chapel Lane. There is a beguiling array of narrow streets and alleyways running off Wirksworth's main thoroughfare. This narrow lane houses the 'Moot Hall' which continues to hold the world's oldest industrial court - the Barmote, on a twice yearly basis.

images.title: Angella Streluk / Black Rocks, Cromford
images.caption: Black Rocks, Cromford. These rocks are interesting to walkers and to climbers alike. The view from them is wonderful.

description: This circular walk around the Derbyshire town of Wirksworth uses various footpaths to visit some of the highlights of the area. Starting in the town you head north and pick up the High Peak Trail to take you up to the Black Rocks around Cromford. From here there are splendid views of the Derwent Valley from the elevated position of the rocks. You can then descend to the Cromford Canal where you have the option of a stroll along the towpath and visiting the historic Cromford Mill. Around here you can also pick up the Derwent Valley Heritage Way and enjoy a riverside walk to Matlock Bath. From the river the walk then heads back across Cromford Moor to Wirksworth on bridleways.
